Introduction.title: Introduction to the ValidatorTool
Introduction.text: The ValidatorTool is a program for validating eCMR documents. This means that you can use the ValidatorTool to ensure that an eCMR document that you have either in printed form or digitally as a PDF file is not counterfeit.

ValidatePdf.title: Validate eCMR as PDF
ValidatePdf.text: If you have the eCMR document as a PDF file on your device, proceed as follows:

list.1: Navigate to the validation page by clicking the "ValidatorTool" link in the navigation bar.
list.3: Then, in the file selection dialog that appears, select the PDF file of the eCMR document that you want to validate.
list.4: If the validity of the document can be confirmed, then you will be redirected to the next page and you will see a green info box confirming the successful validation. Your document has not been counterfeited or edited.
list.5: If problems occur, you will not be redirected and a red info box with further information will appear instead. This can be caused, for example, by a failed connection or if the ValidatorTool cannot confirm the validity of the document. This occurs if the document is not recognized or is counterfeit. The following graphic shows the behavior of the ValidatorTool when the file you upload is not a PDF of a valid eCMR document.

ValidatePrinted.title: Validate printed eCMR
ValidatePrinted.text: If you have the eCMR document in printed form, proceed as follows:

list.1: Navigate to the validation page by clicking the "ValidatorTool" link in the navigation bar as shown in the previous section.
list.2: Fill in the document's eCMR ID and pin code in the corresponding form fields. The eCMR ID and pin code can be found under the document title in the "eCMR" field.
list.3: Click on "Next". The following figure shows the form with sample values and the "Next" button.
list.4: If the ValidatorTool finds an eCMR with the entered eCMR ID and pin code, you will be redirected to the next page and you will see a yellow info box telling you that you can now compare the values retrieved online with your document. You must now match the data on your own to determine if your printed eCMR is correct. If you detect any discrepancies, your document contains errors or it is counterfeit.
list.5: If problems occur, you will not be redirected and instead a red info box will appear containing further information. This can be caused, for example, by an incorrect entry of CMR-No./Pin-Code or failed connection establishment or if ValidatorTool cannot confirm the validity of the document. The following graphic shows the behavior of ValidatorTool when it cannot find a corresponding record online for the CMR ID and pin code you entered.

SetLanguage.title: Language setting
SetLanguage.text: Click on the flag in the upper right corner of the navigation bar and select the desired language.

Electron.note: Note: The validation graphics show the navigation bar of the web version. In your desktop version of the ValidatorTool, instead of the flag, you will see the "Settings" link in this bar, which is discussed in the last two sections of this help page.

list.1: To change the language, navigate to the settings by clicking the "Settings" link in the navigation bar.
list.2: Now click on the flag and select the desired language.

CustomNode.title: Custom node

list.1: To deploy your own Ethereum Node, navigate to the settings by clicking on the "Settings" link in the navigation bar as shown in the previous section.
list.2: Click the checkbox labeled "Own Ethereum Node".
list.3: Now enter the address of your desired Ethereum Node and click "Save".

CustomNode.note: Attention: For security reasons, you should only change this setting if you really trust the Ethereum Node you specified!
